meanings.definition: A type of pie made with molasses and a crumb topping.
meanings.sent1: I baked a delicious shoofly pie for dessert.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells shoofly pies that are always a hit.
meanings.sent3: The shoofly pie was so sweet, it made my teeth ache.
meanings.sent4: Her shoofly pie recipe was a secret family treasure.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the shoofly pie filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: A type of trap used to catch flies.
meanings.sent1: The shoofly caught all the pesky flies in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: He set up a shoofly to keep the house free of insects.
meanings.sent3: The shoofly trap was so effective, it amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The shoofly worked like magic, clearing the room of bugs.
meanings.sent5: The shoofly was a lifesaver during the summer bug season.

meanings.definition: A term used to shoo away flies or other pests.
meanings.sent1: Grandma always said 'shoofly' when she wanted to scare off bugs.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used 'shoofly' to keep the animals safe from insects.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they shouted 'shoofly' at the buzzing flies.
meanings.sent4: The sound of 'shoofly' became a familiar tune on the farm.
meanings.sent5: The word 'shoofly' became a symbol of pest control in the village.
